steps.title: Pre-Action Protocol Compliance
steps.description: Parties are expected to exchange information and attempt to resolve the dispute before commencing court proceedings, in accordance with applicable Pre-Action Protocols.

steps.title: Issuing the Claim
steps.description: Claimant issues a claim form in the County Court or High Court depending on the nature and value of the claim.

steps.title: Service of Claim and Acknowledgment
steps.description: Claim form and particulars of claim are served on the defendant, who may file an acknowledgment of service.

steps.title: Defence and Reply
steps.description: Defendant files a defence and the claimant may file a reply, setting out the issues in dispute.

steps.title: Case Management and Track Allocation
steps.description: Court manages the case and allocates it to the appropriate track (small claims, fast track, or multi-track).

steps.title: Settlement or Alternative Dispute Resolution
steps.description: Court encourages parties to engage in settlement discussions or alternative dispute resolution at all stages of the proceedings.

conditional_branches.effect: Case proceeds to trial on the merits

steps.title: Trial
steps.description: Court hears evidence, examines witnesses, and considers legal submissions from the parties.

steps.title: Judgment
steps.description: Court delivers judgment determining the rights and liabilities of the parties.

steps.title: Appeal
steps.description: Aggrieved party may appeal the judgment to a higher court in accordance with applicable rules.

documents_required: Claim form and particulars of claim

escalation_paths.condition: Appeal on point of law of general public importance
